info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 1 at 6:36PM MDT until August 1 at 9:45PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne WY
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of panhandle Nebraska, including the following county, Kimball and southeast Wyoming, including the following county, Laramie.
* WHEN...Until 945 PM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 636 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pine Bluffs, Bushnell, Oliver Reservoir and Oliver Reservoir Campground. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM MDT THIS EVENING
